properties.areaDesc: Pickens, AL; Marengo, AL; Greene, AL; Hale, AL; Sumter, AL
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 6:55PM CST until January 18 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham AL
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock
and Dam...
...The flood warning continues for the Tombigbee River at Gainesville Lock and
Dam...
...The flood warning continues for the Tombigbee River At Demopolis
Lock and Dam...

While water levels are gradually falling along the Tombigbee River basin at
Bevil Lock and Dam and Gainesville Lock and Dam, minor flood stage continues.
Water levels have remained steady at Demopolis as the river is currently
cresting at this location. A gradual fall in water levels should begin over the
weekend.

The Flood Warning continues for
The Tombigbee River At Bevill Lock and Dam.
* until Saturday evening...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At  5:00 PM Friday the stage was 123.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 122.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to fall to below flood stage by
tomorrow late morning .
* Impact...At 122.0 feet...Cattle in low-lying areas of Southern
Pickens County should be moved to higher ground. Cattle are cutoff
in lowlands of Southern Pickens County at stages above 122 feet.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars through flooded areas.  Turn Around...Don't Drown.

Another statement will be issued by Saturday morning, or sooner if
conditions warrant.
